column4: hi guys,What is the 3 digit number with chmod to make a .bin file executeable? For example sudo chmod xxx file.bin
Thanks I always have trouble with chmod :)
downloaded to a temporary file and sent back when saved
Ahh what about if opened with vi?
are you opening is inside an ssh session in a terminal or using Places > Connect To?
then no, it's not downloaded, the ssh binary transmits everything you see on a terminal back and forth, as if it's local terminal
use nano, it's much more friendlier than VI
use ssh -C (for compressing data back and forth)
Im using putty but im sure theres a noption for that, thanks
do you mean the upload speed for the whole server? try ntop
no, runs in terminal like top
? I dont see anything simple looks like its doing something with a bunch of protocols I just need to test port 80
sprinkle fairy dust on the files
